page.title: 17MILNROW CARNIVAL
page.content: Every year in Milnrow there is a carnival which is held to raise money for local charities. In the carnival there are different groups in fancy dress. There are also floats, Morris dancers, majorettes, church queens and bands. A trophy is presented to the best walking group and another for the best float. After the procession there is a fancy dress competition. One year the carnival starts from Firgrove and the next it starts from Newhey. Each year it ends at Roch Valley High School. In the afternoon stalls are open for refreshments and games in the school grounds. Bands and Morris dancing troupes also take part in the entertainment.
